metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: PHP SimpleXML - Get Node/Attribute Values
SimpleXML is a PHP extension that allows us to easily manipulate and get XML data.
content.html: SimpleXML is a PHP extension that allows us to easily manipulate and get XML data.

content.text: PHP SimpleXML - Get Node Values
Get the node values from the " note.xml " file:
content.html: Get the node values from the "note.xml" file:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
to . "
"; echo $xml->from . "
";echo $xml->heading . "
";echo $xml->body;?>

content.code:
to . "
"; echo $xml->from . "
";echo $xml->heading . "
";echo $xml->body;?>

syntax_highlighting.text:
to . "
"; echo $xml->from . "
";echo $xml->heading . "
";echo $xml->body;?>

content.code_html:
<?php
$xml=simplexml_load_file("note.xml") or die("Error: Cannot create object");
echo $xml->to . "<br>";
echo $xml->from . "<br>";
echo $xml->heading . "<br>";
echo $xml->body;
?>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
to . "
"; echo $xml->from . "
";echo $xml->heading . "
";echo $xml->body;?>

content.text: The output of the code above will be:
content.html: The output of the code above will be:

content.code_html:
Tove
Jani
Reminder
Don't forget me this weekend!

content.text: Another XML File
Assume we have an XML file called " books.xml ", that looks like this:
content.html: Assume we have an XML file called "books.xml", that looks like this:

content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<bookstore>
  <book category="COOKING">
    <title lang="en">Everyday Italian</title>
    <author>Giada De Laurentiis</author>
    <year>2005</year>
    <price>30.00</price>
  </book>
  <book category="CHILDREN">
    <title lang="en">Harry Potter</title>
    <author>J K. Rowling</author>
    <year>2005</year>
    <price>29.99</price>
  </book>
  <book category="WEB">
    <title lang="en-us">XQuery Kick Start</title>
    <author>James McGovern</author>
    <year>2003</year>
    <price>49.99</price>
  </book>
  <book category="WEB">
    <title lang="en-us">Learning XML</title>
    <author>Erik T. Ray</author>
    <year>2003</year>
    <price>39.95</price>
  </book>
</bookstore>

content.text: PHP SimpleXML - Get Node Values of Specific Elements
The following example gets the node value of the <title> element in the first and second <book> elements in the "books.xml" file:
content.html: The following example gets the node value of the <title> element in the first and second <book> elements in the "books.xml" file:

content.code_html:
<?php
$xml=simplexml_load_file("books.xml") or die("Error: Cannot create object");
echo $xml->book[0]->title . "<br>";
echo $xml->book[1]->title;
?>

content.text: The output of the code above will be:
content.html: The output of the code above will be:

content.code_html:
Everyday Italian
Harry Potter

content.text: PHP SimpleXML - Get Node Values - Loop
The following example loops through all the <book> elements in the "books.xml" file, and gets the node values of the <title>, <author>, <year>, and <price> elements:
content.html: The following example loops through all the <book> elements in the "books.xml" file, and gets the node values of the <title>, <author>, <year>, and <price> elements:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
children() as $books) {   echo $books->title . ", ";   echo $books->author . ", ";   echo $books->year . ", ";   echo $books->price . "
"; } ?>

content.code:
children() as $books) {   echo $books->title . ", "; echo $books->author . ", ";   echo $books->year . ", "; echo $books->price . "
"; } ?>

syntax_highlighting.text:
children() as $books) {   echo $books->title . ", ";   echo $books->author . ", ";   echo $books->year . ", ";   echo $books->price . "
"; } ?>

content.code_html:
<?php
$xml=simplexml_load_file("books.xml") or die("Error: Cannot create object");
foreach($xml->children() as $books) {
  echo $books->title . ", ";
  echo $books->author . ", ";
  echo $books->year . ", ";
  echo $books->price . "<br>";
}
?>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
children() as $books) {   echo $books->title . ", ";   echo $books->author . ", ";   echo $books->year . ", ";   echo $books->price . "
"; } ?>

content.text: The output of the code above will be:
content.html: The output of the code above will be:

content.code_html:
Everyday Italian, Giada De Laurentiis, 2005, 30.00
Harry Potter, J K. Rowling, 2005, 29.99
XQuery Kick Start, James McGovern, 2003, 49.99
Learning XML, Erik T. Ray, 2003, 39.95

content.text: PHP SimpleXML - Get Attribute Values

The following example gets the attribute value of the "category" attribute of the first <book> element and the attribute value of the "lang" attribute of the <title> element in the second <book> element:
content.html: The following example gets the attribute value of the "category" attribute of the first <book> element and the attribute value of the "lang" attribute of the <title> element in the second <book> element:

content.code_html:
<?php
$xml=simplexml_load_file("books.xml") or die("Error: Cannot create object");
echo $xml->book[0]['category'] . "<br>";
echo $xml->book[1]->title['lang'];
?>

content.text: The output of the code above will be:
content.html: The output of the code above will be:

content.text: PHP SimpleXML - Get Attribute Values - Loop
The following example gets the attribute values of the <title> elements in the "books.xml" file:
content.html: The following example gets the attribute values of the <title> elements in the "books.xml" file:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
children() as $books) {   echo $books->title['lang'];   echo "
"; } ?>

content.code:
children() as $books) {   echo $books->title['lang']; echo "
"; } ?>

syntax_highlighting.text:
children() as $books) {   echo $books->title['lang'];   echo "
"; } ?>

content.code_html:
<?php
$xml=simplexml_load_file("books.xml") or die("Error: Cannot create object");
foreach($xml->children() as $books) {
  echo $books->title['lang'];
  echo "<br>";
}
?>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
children() as $books) {   echo $books->title['lang'];   echo "
"; } ?>

content.text: The output of the code above will be:
content.html: The output of the code above will be:

For more information about the PHP SimpleXML functions, visit our PHP SimpleXML Reference .
content.html: For more information about the PHP SimpleXML functions, visit our PHP SimpleXML Reference.
